member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.CancelWrite
member.summary: Cancels the current write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is no write operation currently in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0401

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_BufferUnderrunFreeDisabled
member.summary: Determines if Buffer Underrun Free recording is enabled for CDR, CD-RW, and DVD-R media.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if Buffer Underrun Free recording is disabled; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE (enabled).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_ClientName
member.summary: Retrieves the friendly name of the client.
member.param: Name of the client application.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_CurrentMediaStatus
member.summary: Retrieves the current state of the media in the device.
member.param: State of the media in the disc device. For possible values, see the enumeration type. Note that more than one state can be set.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_CurrentPhysicalMediaType
member.summary: Retrieves the type of media in the disc device.
member.param: Type of media in the disc device. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
Value: 0xC0AA0003

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Note This value does not indicate a NULL pointer.Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_DisableConsumerDvdCompatibilityMode
member.summary: Determines if a DVD recording session includes tasks that can increase the chance that a device can play the DVD.

param.name: value
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the session skips the tasks that allow the disc to play on more consumer devices
Is VARIANT_FALSE if the media will be written to maximize read compatibility with consumer devices.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_ForceMediaToBeClosed
member.summary: Determines if further additions to the file system are prevented.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the next write session ends by marking the disc as closed to subsequent write sessions. Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE to keep the disc open for subsequent write sessions.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_ForceOverwrite
member.summary: Determines if the data writer must overwrite the disc on overwritable media types.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the data writer must overwrite the disc on overwritable media types; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_FreeSectorsOnMedia

summary.para:
Retrieves the number of free sectors on the disc for incremental recording (without overwriting existing data).
Note When this method is called for DVD-/+RW, DVD-RAM, and BD-RE media, the reported free sector value represents total capacity, rather than the current number of free sectors. To retrieve free sectors for these media types, the file system must be imported via or , which will allow the use of the method to retrieve the value.

member.param: Number of free sectors on the media in the device.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The requested operation is only valid with supported media.
Value: 0xC0AA0402

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_LastWrittenAddressOfPreviousSession
member.summary: Retrieves the last sector of the previous write session.

param.name: value
param.para: Address where the previous write operation ended.
The value is -1 if the media is blank or does not support multi-session writing (indicates that no previous session could be detected).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Not implemented.
Value: 0x80004001

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_MultisessionInterfaces
member.summary: Retrieves a list of available multi-session interfaces.
member.param: List of available multi-session interfaces. Each element of the array is a VARIANT of type VT_DISPATCH. Query the pdispVal member of the variant for any interface that inherits from interface, for example, .

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

returns.div: Note This method does not return an error when called on blank optical media.

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_RequestedWriteSpeed
member.summary: Retrieves the requested write speed.

param.name: value
param.para: Requested write speed measured in disc sectors per second.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) requests that the write occurs using the fastest supported speed for the media.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.

member.summary: Retrieves a list of the detailed write configurations supported by the disc recorder and current media.

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_SupportedWriteSpeeds
member.summary: Retrieves a list of the write speeds supported by the disc recorder and current media.
member.param: List of the write speeds supported by the disc recorder and current media. Each element of the array is a VARIANT of type VT_UI4. The ulVal member of the variant contains the number of sectors written per second.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
Value: 0xC0AA0003

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Note This value does not indicate a NULL pointer.Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The write failed because the drive returned error information that could not be recovered from.
Value: 0xC0AA0301

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_TotalSectorsOnMedia
member.summary: Retrieves the number of sectors on the media in the device.
member.param: Number of sectors on the media in the device. The number includes free sectors, used sectors, and the boot sector.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.get_WriteProtectStatus
member.summary: Retrieves the current write protect state of the media in the device.

param.name: value
param.para: The current write protect state of the media in the device. For possible values, see the enumeration type.
Note that more than one state can be set.

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.put_BufferUnderrunFreeDisabled

summary.para:
Determines if Buffer Underrun Free recording is enabled.
Note This method is only applicable to CDR/RW and DVD+/-R media formats.

member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to disable Buffer Underrun Free recording; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE (enabled).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0400

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.put_ClientName
member.summary: Sets the friendly name of the client.
member.param: Name of the client application. Cannot be NULL or an empty string.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The client name is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AA0211

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.put_DisableConsumerDvdCompatibilityMode
member.summary: Determines if a DVD recording session includes tasks that can increase the chance that a device can play the DVD.

param.name: value
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to skip the tasks that allow the disc to play on more consumer devices. Removing compatibility reduces the recording session time and the need for less free space on disc.
Set to VARIANT_FALSE to increase the chance that a device can play the DVD. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0400

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.put_ForceMediaToBeClosed
member.summary: Determines if further additions to the file system are prevented.

param.name: value
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to mark the disc as closed to prohibit additional writes when the next write session ends.
Set to VARIANT_FALSE to keep the disc open for subsequent write sessions. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0400

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.put_ForceOverwrite
member.summary: Determines if the data writer must overwrite the disc on overwritable media types.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the data writer must overwrite the disc on overwritable media types; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.put_PostgapAlreadyInImage
member.summary: Determines if the data stream contains post-writing gaps.
member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE if the data stream contains post-writing gaps; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0400

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.put_Recorder
member.summary: Sets the recording device to use for the write operation.
member.param: An interface that identifies the recording device to use in the write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0400

This device does not support the operations required by this disc format.
Value: 0xC0AA0407

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.SetWriteSpeed
member.summary: Sets the write speed of the disc recorder.

param.name: RequestedSectorsPerSecond
param.para: Requested write speed measured in disc sectors per second.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) requests that the write occurs using the fastest supported speed for the media. This is the default.

member.param: Requested rotational-speed control type. Set to VARIANT_TRUE to request constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control type. Set to VARIANT_FALSE to use another rotational-speed control type that the recorder supports. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.

member.name: IDiscFormat2Data.Write

summary.para:
Writes the data stream to the device.
Note For write success, the size of the passed-in stream must be a multiple of the sector size, 2048. This includes operations that utilize streams associated with .iso images not created by IMAPI.

member.param: An IStream interface of the data stream to write.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The write failed because the drive returned error information that could not be recovered from.
Value: 0xC0AA0301

The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
Value: 0xC0AA0003

The requested rotation type was not supported by the drive and the rotation type was adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0005

The requested write speed was not supported by the drive and the speed was adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0004

The requested write speed and rotation type were not supported by the drive and they were both adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0006

This device does not support the operations required by this disc format.
Value: 0xC0AA0407

The request was canceled.
Value: 0xC0AA0002

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0400

The size of the provided IStream object is invalid. The size must be a multiple of the sector size, 2048.
Value: 0xC0AA0403

The current media type is unsupported.
Value: (HRESULT)0xC0AA0406

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

Not implemented.
Value: 0x80004001

summary.para: Use this interface to write a data stream to a disc.
To create an instance of this interface, call the CoCreateInstance function. Use__uuidof(MsftDiscFormat2Data) for the class identifier and __uuidof(IDiscFormat2Data) for the interface identifier.
